thread.title: Seychelles Tourism Minister urges locals to recognise vitality of their museumsTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Seychelles Tourism Minister urges locals to recognise vitality of their museumsTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Seychelles Tourism Minister urges locals to recognise vitality of their museumsTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Seychelles Tourism Minister urges locals to recognise vitality of their museums Published on : Thursday, July 16, 2015
Seychelles Minister for Tourism and Culture, Alain St.Ange stressed the ‘need for the people of Seychelles to recognise the vitality of the museums and monuments and to understand that they are there for our country.’
The Minister said this while meeting the members of two newly appointed advisory boards ̶ the National Monuments Board and the Museums Board.
Attending the two back-to-back meetings held at the Ministry of Tourism & Culture Offices at ESPACE building was the principal secretary for culture Benjamine Rose.
Minister St.Ange said it is vital to break away from the perception of seeing the museums and monuments being solely for the Ministry of Tourism and Culture.
During the first meeting of these two new Boards with the minister, the members of the two boards commended the approach taken by the ministry, adding that having these new boards shows the importance that Minister St.Ange and his team attach to the various aspects of their culture.
Members of both boards also shared their views and discussed the way forward. Discussions also centred on how to make these vital aspects of our heritage become self-sustainable, especially the museums.
Source: Seychelles Tourism Board
